title: String Manipulation Practice
description: Practice string concatenation, formatting, slicing, and methods
starterCode:
# Given variables
first_name = "john"
last_name = "doe"
email = "JOHN.DOE@EXAMPLE.COM"

# Task 1: Create 'full_name' by combining first_name and last_name with a space
# Capitalize the first letter of each word


# Task 2: Convert 'email' to lowercase and store in 'email_lower'


# Task 3: Extract the username from email (part before @) and store in 'username'


# Task 4: Extract the domain from email (part after @) and store in 'domain'


# Task 5: Create a greeting message using f-string:
# "Hello, [full_name]! Your email is [email_lower]."
# Store in variable 'greeting'
solution:
first_name = "john"
last_name = "doe"
email = "JOHN.DOE@EXAMPLE.COM"

full_name = (first_name + " " + last_name).title()
email_lower = email.lower()
username = email_lower.split("@")[0]
domain = email_lower.split("@")[1]
greeting = f"Hello, {full_name}! Your email is {email_lower}."
hints: Use + to concatenate strings with a space between
Use .split('@') to split email into parts

testCases.validation: assert full_name == 'John Doe', f'Expected "John Doe" but got "{full_name}"'
assert greeting == 'Hello, John Doe! Your email is john.doe@example.com.', f'Greeting format incorrect'
